title: F1 champ Lewis Hamilton wants movie about his life and admits he’s so fussy he wants to star in it himself
text:
Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton wants to star in his own biopic (Picture: AP Photo/Andy Brownbill) Lewis Hamilton wants to make a biopic of his life – but weirdly, he wants to play himself.
Here's our first look at Alicia Vikander as the iconic Lara Croft: Tomb Raider No, he’s serious.
The 32-year-old British Formula One champion racing driver is not convinced that anyone else looks enough like him – or could do the Stevenage-raised star justice on the big screen so would have to take on the part himself. That’s not exactly what you call acting, is it?
‘I would probably play myself. I have not seen an actor that looks like me or that I’d particularly want to represent me,’ he told the Confidential On Nova radio show.
We’re not convinced that anyone’s told him how badly this could shake out.
Lewis hasn’t seen anyone he would want to star as him (Picture: Clive Mason/Getty Images) That being said, Lewis has an impressive story – and the screenplay would focus on his rags to riches story and how his dad worked three jobs to support him as a young driver who went on to become three-time world champion who won his first title with McLaren in 2008 before moving to Mercedes, where he won back-to-back titles in 2014 and 2015.
‘My story is about coming from humble beginnings. I am probably the last of a dying breed because pretty much every other driver I’m racing with has come from wealth,’ he said.
‘It will be really telling a family story about where we’ve come from, how we did it as a family, the sacrifices my family made and the trials and tribulations we came across along the way.’

He added: ‘I think it is an inspiring story for people around the world, not to be racing drivers but for anything, for families to stick together as a unit and having dreams and following those dreams and actually achieving them.’
Hamilton is no stranger to rubbing shoulders with filmmakers, having attended Cannes Film Festival several times during 2016 but he admits he’s not yet penned a script.

But looks like Lewis should probably concentrate on his racing season ahead, having already tasted defeat after losing to Sebastian Vettel at the Melbourne Grand Prix.
